TQcVOUnZbp7jnmWqYbBltg.text: Best coffee and brunch in London!! ***** I would also recommend the Shoreditch one as its a lot bigger. No Victorian toilets though! Staff are lovely and all the food is great. Flat whites are a dream with salted caramel brownie on the side

BPbjkWmwkhd2YVCzGKE4Qw.text: First of all, I'm a europhile; especially london. And I am a coffee snob to the core. That being said, the attendant is satisfies everything I could want. The coffee, I'm an espresso drinker, is delicious. And the food is very fresh and tasty. The people who work there are cute london bohemian types, and very friendly. I stayed in London for two weeks on vacation, holiday to them, and visited at least twice for coffee and lunch. I will indeed go back.

Cq7JhD6OtarLJadCS8CZaQ.text: Restaurant bar in old public toilets. London still spoils the assholes. What's the menu, molecular shit.

WjF_bdQd_RM6oqZGRWlJ2Q.text: I was looking for a place to escape a few minutes London's cold winter weather. I found this great, original place and I had a really good peppermint tea and an incredible carrot cake!! :) and prices are just fine.

9gtKJA4-xZUZh12jo7u92g.text: I found this place using a Google search for the best coffee places in London, which came back with a page from Timeout suggesting The Attendant, so I decided to pay it a visit.  Arrive at the gated enclosure, then head down the stairs to the establishment, what a great idea, turning a former Victorian Public Toilet built around 1890 into a coffee shop and leaving some of the original fixtures in place, such as the Urinals, which are now used as individual booths.  It doesn't have a lot of seating, but the seating that is there makes good use of the space, and the food looks very nice. The coffee is great and the staff friendly and approachable. Definitely recommend a visit, if only for the originality. On the way out, there is a whiteboard with pens so you can draw, enter comments etc., also when you get back up the stairs and outside there is also a seating bench around the enclosure to sit and people watch or just have a rest whilst enjoying a great coffee.

EligWy0EcyqmoAhDkmPnmg.text: If you're looking for a quirky place to grab coffee, then this is it. Housed in a former underground, erm, toilet (hence the name), The Attendant has kept much of its original structure (including the urinals! But don't worry, they're well scrubbed up :)) and thus, its character.They're also one of the few cafes in London that serves almond milk, which is great for those of us who are lactose intolerant and might not always want to opt for soy. I went during lunchtime and had a delicious almond milk latte, and a sandwich. My friend went for a cappuccino and a cake, which also looked super appealing.I'd try to visit during off-peak hours, if I were you, so you can stay and enjoy your coffee in the surroundings. The staff there are very friendly as well, which helps.

T2QSojP_xA5E69Q4-J-8Kg.text: A 19th century urinal that was converted into a coffee house - need I say more? But wait, actually I do! So, I'm not much of a coffee connoisseur, but I do know enough to recognise a great cup of coffee and this was certainly that.  Even without the lure of its quirky history, this spot is a gem.I really liked the little bell you can ring to have your coffee served to you outside- which, could  be easily missed as its not very visible. A lot smaller than I was expecting, so not ideal for a coffee date, but probably more appropriate for a quick pit stop, or a coffee to go.They also had some yummy looking cakes and cookies, and impressively a gluten free option too. Definitely a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. #wisewords

7kfn4rFmLRfHd7sO7HQ5TQ.text: A unique coffee shop set into an old toilet/urinals. It works really well with nice staff that manage to pump out some amazing Flat Whites.Pastries also looked very appetising but only stopped by for a flying visit.Sure it's small, so make sure you have an alternate plan. This was the second time I visited, as the first we couldn't get anywhere to sit as it was full. (Visit - 27/06/2015 Coffee)

6Os8-ND72F7wbi4If0zrtQ.text: If you think its cool to have a cuppa joe in a a 19th century urinal then by all means be my guest. The place is small and has mad accoustics, so if there's one loud ass person in the place you'll hear every word which gets annoying. Good strong coffee, and friendly staff, but funny enough NO bathrooms in the joint. Go figure.

Yh5x81s2GlwAhtY5sx3nwg.text: 'Attendant' - a name that both refers to the former denizen of this underground space - which was a public toilet for so many years - as well as the present participle of the French verb 'attendre'... Why is that relevant? Well, as soon as it was announced that that someone was finally doing something with this brilliant space outside the Crown & Sceptre pub, this word seemed doubly-appropriate as counting down each day to it's opening - this morning - seemed to last an eternity...It really is a lovely space; not very large but beautifully restored, with some of the seating opposite the bar incorporating the ornate tops of the old urinals (cleaned very throughly, we can only be sure!) for you to settle your flat white and pulled pork sandwich between.The coffee is very good - as it would need to be with Kaffeine a mere 100m down the road! A rotating cast of different beans from the London roasters were being very competently pulled by the young baristas behing the counter when I visited. I've not tried any of their lunch offerings as I popped in for a takeaway coffee only, but if their espresso is any gauge of the quality of the food, then we're all in for a treat.The real star is the space though - descending below street level for your morning fix will likely never lose its novelty value, and I look forward to seeing how the place evolves over the next year. If you're within striking distance and need a quality caffeine-fix (weekdays-only at the moment, by the looks of things), get 'down' here as soon as you can...Fitzrovians have never had it better.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Attendant's baristas are pulling even better coffee than when they opened six weeks ago!
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. The cafe interior
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom

DW2udQqh6x1-65A77z3oKQ.text: This little coffee shop was such a pleasure to visit.You descend down the stairs found seemingly off-centre at a random intersection, and then you are greeted by lovely staff and a display of a lot of delicious food. I got an iced americano, and my friend got a flat white. Maybe it was the fact that it's finally warm enough to get an iced drink, but my coffee was one of the best coffees I've ever had! So yummy. I can't speak for my friend, but her flat white was the cutest thing ever with a perfect milk heart on top. I forgot the name of my sandwich - a long sandwich with beef, - but that too was very good. I was so tempted by all of the pastries, but I was pretty full from the food. The staff were so helpful as well. The woman working there explained most of the food and pastries to me, and let us get comfortable before we made our decisions. The bathroom was really clean as well. Sitting at a urinal to eat/drink was also an interesting experience. I will definitely try to come back before I leave London.

nfZeN9Clo46VdGIOXFHgjA.text: So you've gathered by now, you head down the stairs not the loo but for a caffeine hit.Quite possibly the coolest place to get coffee in town. So cool in fact, that it borders on pretentious, but not quite. Great coffee, really awesome staff too. Mint-infused water in jugs on the side. Sit solo, separated by ornamented ceramic urinal vestibules, or be more social in the re-fashioned booths at the back.Funnily enough, if you do happen to need the bathroom, there is just one functioning lavatory remaining at your service.Oh and the salted caramel brownie is a winner.

Bm6xnbUjWzdBVBLwe5b_Jw.text: This is probably one of the coolest coffee shops I've ever visited! Hidden away in the lovely Fitzrovia area, as many have mentioned before its a converted public toilet that has been converted into an underground coffee shop. The shop itself is tiny but a nice place to chat with friends or break out your laptop for a study session (they have free wifi!)  The coffee is great and the staff is friendly! Make sure to stop by if you're ever in the area.

TvCxT6V1O1JjHR93FYI1CQ.text: Hubby and I have eyed this coffee shop for a while now after reading a lot about it and passing by it on our way home from one of the other many coffee shops in the area. It always looked inviting; I mean, a public toilet turned coffee shop? What's not to ooh and ahh over? =)Finally, a little trip into manic Oxford Street gave us an excuse to stop in for a wee break (ahhh hahaha, see what I did there?). As always, it was wonderful to step away from the chaos of Oxford Street onto a side street leading to the entrance of the shop, which, as you can guess from my intro, looks like one of those old public toilets underground.I had a jasmine tea (loose leaf), hubby and friend had flat whites, and I shared a sea salt caramel brownie. The tea came in a lovely little teapot and accompanying mug, but I thought the water temperature was just a tiny bit too hot and the tea was subsequently a little bitter. Not horrible, though, so I think it was all right. Hubby thought his flat white was just OK, too. The brownie, though, was DELICIOUS. Just gooey and a scrumptious mix of caramel, salt, and, of course, chocolate! Definitely recommend that treat if it's there. The atmosphere and space is great. It's laid back and just cool to see the remnants of the toilets here and there and to see how they incorporated those elements into the interior design. So I'd visit just to have the experience! But the seating is very limited, so I think groups of 2-3 are the most ideal...I really enjoyed visiting, but with other great coffee nearby, I'm not sure if I'll be hurrying back, so though this is probably more in between 3 and 4 stars, I've decided to go with 3.

VFpiFho-zNC8gGJdmCTKyA.text: A quirky coffeeshop in Fitzrovia. The coffee is quite good, as they use Caravan beans - my Americano had the nice acidity, fruity taste I enjoy of Caravan.  They also have an assortment of snacks, sandwiches, and lunch options (today's stew was beef stroganoff); I got the salted caramel brownie (as recommended by many other Yelpers), which was deliciously fudgey and creamy, with the perfect sprinkle of salt.  Also, really friendly staff and nice layout - who wouldn't have to coffee in a toilet?

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Americano (2.5) with milk and salted caramel brownie (3.3) a la toilet

yPop0SFfScH8ytSHsIQ7vw.text: Great flavorful espresso that really rang out with cherrystone and bright top notes. The location is amazing, an inspiring use of old space that stays well this side of kitschy. The staff is very nice and it was cool and calm on a busy London Sunday.Sinfully ridiculous pastries too (I had a cupcake made of mini Oreos and peanut butter).

HzxKuUlJ4aQ4yFIhVfes8Q.text: Ha, ha ... you have to start with a laugh and a WTF in your own head if not out loud. A toilet based coffee shop. How predictable is any joke that may come next!?So, I'd just basically been shoved out of Kaffiene, 50m or so up the road, as the need to shove in more customers seemed more important than keeping those already fed and watered and paid up happy! They can kiss my ... in future. Anyway, my post-double cataract operation eagle eyes spied Attendant in the mid-distance and, never one to follow the conventional route by only visiting the hipster approved joints, I ventured into what is actually a converted public lav. Kaffiene's loss was my gain. Such is the joy of serendipity!Yeah, so that's really cool as I descend the stairs ... literally, it is super-cool down there after the heat of the mean London Summertime streets! First impression: hey have some food, usual stuff, a pretty small counter but lots of perch type seats all around the edges of the room, plus crazy tabletops part made out of the old urinals. Check out the pictures folks have posted (I took some but too lazy just now to process).Service mildly snotty, but warmed up quickly when the guy realised even fat old geezers can be cool and hip if you give them a chance!! Ordered my standard test drink of flat-white and this time had a bit of banana cake. It was mainly moist and suitably banana-ish, so all was fine scoff-wise. The coffee came over. Didn't like the cup, or more the trendy handle, but won't nit-pick. I'd liked (tho' not loved) the Kaffeine coffee, but this was better. Hard to believe I know ... but to my palate there was less sharply acidic edge and it suited me better, so that is good enough. You may prefer it acidic. Up to you. Doesn't make you a bad person.I asked to take a few photo's and the staff warmed up even more and definitely encouraged it. I almost loved them by now such was the all round unpretentiousness and willingness to please any who ventured in. The barista was genuinely a nice person and went out of their way to help. She made a good cup from a very good espresso machine (La Marzocco). One of the nicest flatties I've had down cockney way and possibly ever! The beans are from Caravan, a well known supplier but one of the few I haven't sampled much of in a 'professional capacity', other than at Yorks in Birmingham (much better here at Attendant, tho' may be different beans). Thankfully, it wasn't the ubiquitous (and no doubt excellent to others tastes) Square Mile.

eTaQZOTdf4w4ejjtqQ6pDw.text: Such a great, quirky little coffee shop! I'd heard about this place before and stumbled across it while I was walking the other day and just had to go down and check it out.There were lots of people inside so it's obviously very popular. Very quirky decor which I loved. There wasn't a huge amount of choice for food. Only a couple of cakes and savoury options. It would be good if there was a few more options BUT that's only a minor thing. The coffee was some of the best I've had! Very rich. And they serve freshly squeezed orange juice which is always great! I had a peanut butter and chocolate chip cookie and it was delicious. Highly recommend! The staff were all so friendly and chatty. Great place with a lot of character

o-9ePAm-QgG1NZjou-0akQ.text: Friendly staff, really great coffee and such a cool look. A great place to stop, sit and think. Such a nice atmosphere. Even my friend who is a coffee snob loves it.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom

rA0nZusbTJNF-zi_5qJf2Q.text: A very cosy coffee shop (converted from public restrooms!) - limited selection of foods, though it includes all your breakfast favourites including smashed avocado on toast, freshly pressed juice, and a line of pastries. Friendly staff, and quirky decor. Drop on in if you're in the area!

8vcfwTQnSmIWszFYWg10Cg.text: Small & cosy, this is a must for anyone on a hunt for amazingly made coffee & a communal atmosphere.  Their brunch menu is small, but extremely well executed. Just get there early, as the little once upon a time Victorian loos fills up with hungry patrons quickly.

pQGhMLVmk-EIdv8Cb2j4Fg.text: This is my favourite cafe in the world. I almost don't want to review it, in the hopes of keeping it a great local secret.-Unique location and design (Antique toilets! But very throughly cleaned and polished)-GREAT music yet relaxed, chill vibe that's not too loud or overwhelming-Excellent Australian-style coffee-The most incredible weekend French Toast ever... (please never change it!)-All the other food is delicious-And importantly, consistently friendly, chill staff who never rush you or yell orders over you (unlike many other popular coffee shops in London)It is a little bit on the pricey side but it's justifiable given the care they put into every aspect of this place.

oI3BXqoQ8mnVqWyuG1KGOQ.text: This is a unique little place in what used to be an old Victorian toilet.  I have to admit, I was apprehensive about going in at first, especially when my boyfriend told me it still looked like a toilet.  However, he wouldn't let up and his curiosity, coupled with his early-at-work-late-back-home business hours, made me the "go to girl".  So, I walked down the steps and into a clean, friendly and original little cafe.  The wall behind the counter is a bespoke unit of shelves filled with canned fruit in mason jars.  The lighting on this wall is such that it looked like an art installation straight from mom's pantry.  There is a small bench seating area with table, and along the walls in what used to be the toilet stations, there is now a "bar style" eating counter perfect for individuals.  Now, of course I kept considering that this is where men used to do their business, but the Victorian rolled porcelain is just so pretty and everything is CLEAN!  The ceilings are pegboard style.  Picture country kitchen with a modern twist.  Overall it was just cool.As for the food, the baked goods looked delicious, though I had a croissant, which is hard to do wrong.  When I asked for butter and jam, I was brought a small plate with butter and apple compote (obviously homemade).  This was superb.  My latte was strong and quite good as well.  There is also a small condiments counter with cubed sugar to sweeten your coffee and free water in pitchers garnished with sliced cucumber, a nice touch.  There is also a bell for curbside service.  And during the spring there will be outside seating.The staff working was very kind and willing to chat with me about the choice of location, food, etc.  As an additional plus, the owner (or at least I think he was the owner) was there working on his laptop.  He put his heart and hard labor into this place and it shows.  I found out from him that there was actually a piece done on KRLD by Mike Rogers in Dallas, Texas about putting a slogan with this little shop.  I'm sure this was done in jest, so seeing as I'm from Dallas I'll be sure to get back to Mr. Rogers with the message that this is definitely a place I will "go" again and again and again when I'm in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Small seating area.
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Yummy brunch!
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Dining space.

nPYNzimsMmTLsrkhkEBSqQ.text: I love drinking coffee in a toilet.... Actually no, I normally don't. But here at Attendant I really do. Located in a former underground communal toilet this place is away from the Oxford Street crowds. The coffee is really great and the baked goods looks amazing too.

s1TMSdnXIHx7MZTPTW18Ww.text: Great use of space for a fantastic coffee and sandwich bar.  I had the roast beef bagel sandwich with rocket.  Delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. The outside of the Attendant on. Spring morning.

iByKzrC-yPrqeZajFpvIwQ.text: My favorite eatery in London! The coffee, the almond croissants, the sourdough bread,...I could keep going....were all amazing! The service was excellent!

mK4SmYuRjcBwrkoEtSaibA.text: The card machine wasn't working when I visited which threatened to thwart my coffee purchase as I'm one of those godawful people who rarely carries money. BUT a kindly stranger volunteered to buy my coffee! My first thought was 'omg no I can't let you do that' but then I thought hey, they wouldn't have offered unless they were comfortable doing it, and it's something I think I'd do myself if the roles were reversed. So thanks kind stranger if you happen to read this! My flat white was really nice, small and strong and hot (these are all characteristics I want in a flat white). I didn't get any food or cakes but there were lots of interesting looking options. Overall this place is cute and quirky and frequented by generous/kind customers!

nIQTPXG1a64j1X8gW5qV7g.text: This place is amazing! Its located underground in a former tube station bathroom (that may sound gross but its not, its totally awesome). It's small and cozy, but doesn't feel cramped. The staff is super friendly and the food was delicious. We ordered the avocado toast with poached eggs, and some kind of banana bread served with berries and some delicious homemade whipped cream. All of the food was to die for (look at my picture and see for yourself). We also ordered tea, which came loose leaf in really cool glass pots. It was probably the best tea I had in London. If you are in London you have to come by and see the Attendant, even if you just stop by for a coffee or tea. It will be an awesome experience that you will remember for years. PROS-amazing food-fabulous tea-reasonable prices-awesome location/building-friendly staffCONS-WiFi didn't work

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Amazing tea, food, and location here at Attendant!

KAssk8RiLzx6_U-F9Wy3eQ.text: Great customer service, cappuccino, smashed avocado on toast with a side of smoked salmon and a urinal turned into a table. All wonderfuly unusual for a Wednesday lunch break. The messy writing on the walls brought the cheekiness of it down a bit and my coffee was the size of a thimble which lost it a star, but despite that, I would definitely go back to try out the other food they have to offer.

Eln25aomJ7xRyXXh6e1VSQ.text: Wasn't too overly impressed with this cafe. Sure it has it's own little uniqueness being underground and in an old toilet. Bar that nothing special (we came across way better toilet type cafes later in our travels ) .It does have a nice cosy atmosphere , place is clean , a fair selection of food, service is good but the coffee was nothing to rave about and the wrap I had was likewise. Overall if I lived there I wouldn't make it my regular cafe and I would recommend others if they must go , just go( if at all )to see what it's all about. One more footnote...it is good that they have managed to preserve the actual building though instead of it being blocked up or dug up like others I know of. I mean it is kind of history isn't it?.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom

vMeQC5PTS1f0GIwASDvhqA.text: My husband and I are coffee snobs. This was our favorite coffee shop throughout our whole 3-week trip around Europe. We went back multiple times! Try the flat white and the avocado toast (add the egg).

Pcg35mByJq84oTAOxdqC9w.text: George Michael must be disappointed that public loos are being converted into hipster coffee shops these days...Nice coffee shop in the midst of Fitzrovia. They offer your standard range of the modern coffee shop: coffee in all its variation (from lattes, to flat whites etc), an assortment of fancy teas, sandwiches on English muffins or large slices of bread, brownies and other stuff. If you're a woman and always wanted to know about what a male loo looks from the inside - this is your chance to find out!

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Should we help this cause?
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Reminds me of my school days...

2I5DZDZDIeFxNqAKlgRPpQ.text: White or Black?- Sorry?White or Black Coffee..? - What is that? So today I learned that white coffee is coffee with milk ; ___ ; oh my narrow minded mind from the US.This lovely little victorian bathroom was converted into a coffee shop and - can I say that they produce some delicious coffee. When I heard about such a novelty I had to go check it out! I love that they kept some of the design from the porcelain urinals and converted them into seating booths.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom

FUnCpvLaHawsQk1l0GEybQ.text: What a fun treasure to find! Attendant used to be an underground men's restroom turned into this delicious little coffee treat!We enjoyed some of the  best tea in London here and the smashed avocado on toast was delish! So delicious we went back to have it the next day too. Not only do I recommend this place, I will make a point Togo back he next time we are in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Attendant from the street,inside, and the smashed avocado on toast!

2Hc5C1UsUh2LOYQcwWYsow.text: Most people have rated this 5 stars, but I guess the only thing preventing me giving it 5 is just how tiny it really is. I came here to pass on two hours of time in London in-between meetings to crack open my laptop and get on with some work. It did the job for this, however I was propping my laptop up on the tiniest of wooden bench tables. Maybe I just need to get an iPad!Size situation aside - this place is way cool. It's an underground, slightly hidden cafe, where you go downstairs under the road to access. With walls adorned with graffiti and quirky images, it's a laid back, unique little place, ideal for catching up with friends, having a coffee or a light lunch. I went for the roasted vegetable soup and it was delicious - so thick and tasty, packed with all sorts of vegetables. Really warming on a freezing cold rainy day in Jan. It came with slices of buckwheat toast which made it more of a filling meal. I decided to take a break from my usual coffee addiction and get a green tea instead, which came in it's own rather cute teapot. Friendly staff, a nice atmosphere and the best R&B mix on in the background! Personal preference I guess :) They offer so many tempting homemade cakes and sweet treats, plus a couple of other lunch options like avocado on rye toast, superfood salads and mainly healthy options. A nice spot to visit in London when you don't want to go to a chain place...

u_ULUHZ4gSXqOHBvWehPGw.text: I'm a sucker for kitchey and cutesy things. GPS failed me many times and I almost gave up finding the place, then I turned a corner and there it was. You walk downstairs and the first thing you notice is the 80's music blasting (Bon Jovi Day when I was there), and of course the urinals. The staff greet you when you come in and the food is delicious. I also tried their salted brownie to go and it was to die for. Cute, cute cute!

a7jceEjK2ceprC1KvTpqcQ.text: It's a nice place to have a coffee  shop underground .. Nice design it's my first time to visit a place with this interesting decor idea .. It's something different than others .., I ordered for a latte and protein ball Covered by coconuts It was delicious .. Mostly people coming to have a take away coffee .. Staff are friendly and lovely ., price are good . I was asking my self my they choose this decor ??

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom

qUy5sXSk1I59dQYxhPPXew.text: Very good Flat White and nice staff. I don't know what I expected but it is small. It is perfectly formed but the seats on the side with proper tables are much better than the admittedly pretty stools in front of the serving bar for single seating. As you look on away from it all it does seem cramped there. That said its a short stop off to check out this most unique of coffee shops. Must be only one i know housed within an ex toilet. Good use though and good coffee!

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom

7B0KGIfv9AzCLpKyPCuXLg.text: I wasn't familiar with the whole underground toilet thing, but someone I met in Iceland recommended this spot for good coffee and unique setting (and explained the name). I went on a weekday afternoon and was one of very few customers, so service was stellar and I chatted a bit with the barista. Ordered a flat white and took a seat on the stools. Definitely not comfortable enough to stay long, but it was a nice respite and very cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Lighting and seating and urinal remnants

emAPuiYyneWhzrqzDDQ9zA.text: Yesterday I ate french toast in a toilet. Well, a converted public toilets under Foley Street in Central London called The Attendant. Me and four friends had made plans to meet for lunch somewhere central, and we were struggling to whittle down the thousands of London establishments to just one. This seemed like the best option as it was something different, located centrally and didn't seem too formal for what was a quick catch-up.Seating OptionsA friend and I turned up around 12.30pm, and the first thing that struck me was the exceedingly small number of seating options available. After all, this is a converted toilet! Thankfully, round the corner to the right there's a couple of tables with bench seating, so we managed to get an area for the five of us. It's not possible to book ahead as far as I know, so I would recommend only going here if there's just two of you to avoid disappointment.The FoodFrench toast was about £8 each, and sandwiches ranged Chorizo & Bacon, Royale Chicken to Mushroom and Halloumi. By 12.30pm they had ran out of the other brunch specials. They also had a selection of pastries and cakes on offer at the counter too.The AtmosphereThe staff are SO nice! As well as that, their soundtrack was top notch and the lighting was just perfect for an underground venue. I particularly liked the fact that so much light filters through from the main entrance, making it feel that little bit bigger. It was a bit cramped, and the couple next to us kept having to hunch over their table so people could get to the toilet. As such, this is not the place for a two-hour long natter. It has an in-n-out vibe, you wouldn't expect to be here for more than 45 minutes especially as the food is served pretty quickly.This is by no means the first converted toilet in London (Cellar Door and Ginglik are just two that spring to mind), but the space is beautiful, light and if I worked that little bit closer to this place, I would definitely pop in here for a pre-work caffeine fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Vanilla dipped french toast with a side of fresh fruit.
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Royale Chicken sandwich
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. The converted urinal area, ideal for couples or eating alone.

WeBqnpp2oW87rXW8se37kA.text: Amazing gem tucked away in a converted subway restroom. It sounds weird but has some great character. Iced coffee and quiche were amazing.

9iN59Qw7y9a32NJ5dRWeOQ.text: Went here to find a place to do some reading and get decent coffee, both of which I was able to do (although would not recommend trying to do any serious sort of work here probably). I got the flat white and a brie cheese sandwich, both of which were quite good.. The place itself is super hip and cool though, worth checking out just for location! I'd recommend it for sure if you're in the area.

L_1UKxn7a5mViEl1midGcw.text: I loved this place! It was about 1:00pm on a monday and there were people inside but not too many. Easy to find a place to sit. The staff was helpful and genuinely friendly. They have a £5 minimum if you're using a card so I got a flat white and gluten free lemon polenta cake (a recent obsession of mine). The presentation was beautiful with coffee art and they actually had to cut the cake! Not pre-sliced. The coffee was delicious and the cake was hands down THE BEST ever. The edges seemed hard and over cooked at first, but when I took a bite it was densely saturated and almost caramelized lemony deliciousness. When the barista brought my coffee he also brought me a glass of water. Now that's service. The stools are not the most comfortable unfortunately, and unless you grab a table you're stuck staring at a wall. But there is some art to look at. The music was great, the perfect level for conversation but just a little too loud for reading. All in all I will definitely be coming back.

FvMvlUiLpFAPzp3mh1KrHg.text: Absolutely excellent. Had avocado toast with poached eggs and a latte. Staff was friendly and the food was perfect. Would highly recommend.

5AcuO1hR7EPt6uNKd7QCjg.text: Visited here while on vacation in London and after finding it (London needs some more street signs) immediately fell in love with this place. The food and the staff were fantastic and if it hadn't been my last day in London I definitely would have returned for some more.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. A great breakfast!

goyIWbR9dDNyoV8OW5CHbQ.text: I'm glad there were signs otherwise I would have just walked straight past it!! The descent to the café itself is so pretty. You kinda forget it was a public toilet once upon a time. The little almost private table booths with rhe tall chairs are great. You definitely realise they were urinals once but not in a kind of UGH THIS IS SO WEIRD. But in a kind of HA HA OH WOW way. Their coffee is soooo smooth and tasty. Definitely worth having a cup. I had the poached eggs on brioche with avocado and smoked salmon and it was LUSH. The eggs were poached Just Right which often doesn't happen and it ends up being too hard and no gooey yolk, or too runny and you get the icky white goo everywhere.  BUT NOT THERE!

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Brioche + Avocado + Smoked Salmon + Poached Eggs + Rocket = HELL YEAH HELL YEAH HELL YEAH
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Smooth af coffee - hot damn.
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. The tall seats make me feel small in a cute Thumbelina way.

bW1RSNs6If7-ppzGHD7YhQ.text: This place is a bit of a novelty that is trying really hard (with some success) to be a coffee shop.  It is virtually impossible to sit in, so if that is what you had in mind go elsewhere.  If you just want to grab and go, fine.  The coffee is good (although in this neighborhood that is the norm).  I also had a bacon roll but could not eat because the bacon was raw.

nn6YhZtB1eluPQH4JrhWUA.text: While this place may be a hole in the wall, or rather a hole in the ground, their flavors are not. This cafe, with a distinct style and atmosphere is not as it seems. Their small seating area if arriving at an early time can be quite cozy. As for their food. Let me just start by saying Avocado Toast, watch out. This place surpassed my expectation as I have stepped out of the social norm of avocado toast and instead experimented with their Chili Pea smashed toast. Now let me just say WOW!! Total game changer and if paired with their Berry smoothie, be ready for an out of this world experience of  super foods. Overall, highly recommend it. If you can find it.

pvhfLPdFQsMKQObrtylfJg.text: Cafes and bars in decommissioned public loos are a thing, and I finally had an excuse to visit the Attendant.  The tiny cafe was packed on a late Friday morning but we didn't have to wait long until a table became available - sadly not one of the cosy alcoves bordered by what used to be the urinals, but one of the few tables big enough to seat two people.You get a free coffee if you buy your beans here (spotted too late on this occasion but well worth remembering!).  The cappuccino was great and I liked the touch of frozen jam jars for water.  The lunch menu is rather limited, two or three sandwiches, a tart and salad.  Mind you, if they are all as delicious as my aubergine sandwich you are in for a treat.  Simply the best of its kind I ever had - and I have had loads - all ingredients freshly prepared, not a hint of mass manufactured pesto sauce in this one!So, more than a gimmick and well worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom

Yn3v2X-sLfOwIUQTbPkPzQ.text: This place is aesthetically perfect: plentiful plants, subway tile, a wall by the door where you can sign your names, and lots of light -- and the food is perfectly on trend: avocado, maple bacon (that I haven't been able to get out of my mind), vegan cream cheese, all delicious. The portions were a tiny bit small, but the quality and flavor is incredible. Did I mention that maple bacon?! Great tea as well!

tCxdIDveTNaJpeFIP3g1wA.text: This is a lovely cafe! Small but very comfortable. Great service, delicious sandwiches, and tasty coffee. Will definitely be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom

w7wJTx4Mdbul3oi7A0EALQ.text: This place is amazing! The coffee is great, the food is absolutely to die for (I suggest the pancakes with the raspberry purée) and they even add the nice touch of bringing a pitcher of water with infused mint leaves. And, let's be real, it's in a Victorian men's urinal. Hilarious! Just a great experience all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Delicious brunch! Pancakes with raspberry puree, granola, and apple compote!

IwFUFmhKrdR1gCJCKiCapA.text: Small place, so arrive early for a seat.  Great selection of meals for everyone.   Friendly staff.

IqytcR4lxxXSIX7JayOf1A.text: A very quirky and unique cafe but alas the staff were unfriendly and the food was tasteless. We entered the cafe in its unique setting a converted gents toilet , walked to the counter and started scouring the list of coffees and food . The waitress seemed agitated that we were taking our time to order ,we decided on a sweet corn and Sundried tomato salad and mushroom tart ,royal chicken sandwich and salted caramel brownie plus two coffees. The chicken sandwich had hardly any filling and was tasteless,the salad and tart were ok at best and the brownie very average.When the waitress came to collect the plates and we explained how bad we thought the sandwich was she just shrugged her shoulders and walked away. Very poor customer service!But this place is worth visiting just for its uniqueness .

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom

95QvLak8-9mR0qCSjXspAw.text: Another coffee bar in London. Client took me there and have to say that it was the best coffee I've ever had in an underground toilet. It'd be a top contender for the above ground world too.

5ycQSd6L9c1Wa97BNn57Zw.text: Small but cost coffee shop! Reminded me of something you'd find in Brooklyn, NY! Great food and sour lemonade (without fizz)

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom

qCdEqxCx_bojZq-QsCryBw.text: blew my mind away. If I could combine the perfected smoothest, creaminess and richness of coffees you have ever had then this is the result of what is produced here. The coffee bean they use seem to have a slight sweet nuttiness in it that made it was insanely good. That texture and flavour was more pronounced in the flat white being warmer in temperature but the latte was more refreshing, not even once losing that silkiness even as the ice melted.Although we didn't order any good there were a few sweet treats available for order. They all look scrumptious but I can't comment further than that. For all coffee lovers, this place is a must go. Free wifi too.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Food section
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Doodle on the wall
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Iced latte and flat white

v2lMjsHqyXnAUEqq-NH2qQ.text: 5 stars for the very awesome venue! 1 star for service. 1.5 stars for food and coffee. Must be honest, this notion of a cafe joint underground and in the old Foley Street men's bathroom is so flipping cool, I just had to check it out. The space is amazing, a bit cramped, super hot and humid, but what could be expected from an old restroom? I adore how they have a cast iron entrance at the surface, which leads to the stairwell down to the venue. The old tile as well as urinals along the walls are odd yet very interesting touches, and I really enjoy what they've done with the space. The service was.... disappointing. They are not very friendly, perhaps they were distracted or having a bad day, but in such a cool place, I would have expected a little more energy and warmth. I felt an uncomfortable, almost, "drink your cappuccino and eat your cold seed porridge and get out," sort of vibe.I had to try the "cold porridge" for interest's sake, and it was not my thing. The fresh fig garnish was delicious! But everything beneath it felt like mushy and gelatinous crushed seashells in my mouth. I'm honestly not sure what was inside it, I think huge chia seeds along with some other white crunchy seeds that didn't feel palatable. This was also £6-odd pounds!  Perhaps I chose wrong, and should have stuck with the other pastries, sandwiches, or salads laid out, that did look really delicious and appetizing.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. On the surface, heading down under
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Some weird cold seed porridge. And a delicious fig!
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Urinal cubbies for sitting!

u6dYU7NR17bUWMSGDmghGA.text: Unbelievably, this place really used to be a former toilet. Urinals still there but have been changed into tables, there is free wifi and the place is just incredibly unique. I haven't sat down inside as I have seen others do, but the coffee is incredible. If you're in the area, it is worth having a look even if you're not into coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Urinals are still there, cleverly turned into tables. Don't worry, they are clean

lMk-QPRnvC2YyCeJy82NAA.text: I was really excited to come to Attendant since my sister and I are both coffee shop fanatics. The place is really cute and well taken care of. They have nice music, the food looks tasty, and they have a nice selection of drinks! If you're looking for lunch, this might not be the place to go, since their portions are small. However, it is the perfect place for sitting down and chatting with friends. The seats are not very comfortable, which is why I'm giving it 3 out of 5. So if you have a bad back, it's not the best place to sit for a long time.Overall, I really enjoyed my time here! Highly recommend to anyone who is a die hard fan of quirky coffee shops!

PmcGE0lOppSqJmV-6yBMMA.text: Not the best if you get claustrophobic easily - Luckily I don't so of course I loved this place!Another back street hidden treasure in London, this tiny but perfect coffee & brunch/lunch stop is downstairs in a converted public toilets (yup you read that right).I'm a complete sucker for architecture and anywhere that reclaims heritage spots like this and puts them to good use gets a full thumbs up from me. But if the novelty of the space isn't enough for you it's still worth a visit for the decadent food and beverages served up on quaint vintage tin plates.Delicious coffee, food for the soul and it's made full use of the small architecturally sound space it occupies (and I love a barista who can make a soya latte to the right temperature without burning the milk). Try the crayfish on brioche sandwich - I did and it was mouth melting deliciousness - but I'll be going back for the smashed avocado on sourdough!

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom

a8Rqm32D933qzzr83lspFg.text: Great Little Brunch Spot in Fitzrovia Former Victorian toilet, what a charming place. They have left the sinks and toilet flushes up on the wall, love it. Friendly staff and for being a Sunday brunch peak-time we were surprised to get a table.Short but sweet menu of brunch dishes. The menu changes regularly, so I'd love to come back for lunch & coffee one day - it's just a stone throw away from my office. I tried the Middle Eastern, with home-made baked falafel, honey miso roasted aubergine and jerusalem artichoke. I added portabello mushrooms.For not having a proper kitchen (all food prepared at the coffee counter), I was so impressed by how complex this dish looked. Even little edible flowers.Delicate Middle Eastern flavours. Loved the home-made falafel. My friend had the Corn Fritter Stack, with poached eggs, avocado, tomato and bacon. Very comforting brunch dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. The Middle Eastern Corn Fritter Stack & Flat White

PKnlvETpXgzOg7ldo8JgKQ.text: Today was the day baby! Not the day I adopted a giraffe named Sisco..Nor was it the day I gave up champagne .Today it was the day I had brunch in what used to be a men's urinal!!! Life is a joyous thang!Anyhoo its small and warm downstairs and the staff are friendly and polite! I went for the smashed avocado on sourdough bread with poached eggs,betroot humus and smoked salmon. YUMMMMMMY!!!!!!!! Seriously delicious!I tucked into that plate as if my life depended on it! surprised they didn't throw me out for public indecency haha As I'm a foodie I couldn't let this trip go to waste and so my sister and I ordered a portion of their winter berry banana toast with cream and syrup! .......MONEY MAKERRRRRR!!! this was to die for!! Even though we didn't even finish our first course we hammered into this baby in a way MC hammer would be proud of! Crazy reference but bare with me! Overall loved it! Defo Defo going back! Only downside for me was that the stools didn't have a backrest and so after all that hammering into the food I needed support! Mentally and physically! Could've done with a back rest but apart from that yes I had a lovely brunch worth calling my great aunt zelda about! ....... OK so I don't have a great aunt Zelda but you get the drift

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. How hygenic is this? Lol who cares when the food is that good
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Winter berry banana toast ...  Aka stairways to heaven via the palette
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Hellllllo food coma

2EHnd0-nZkh5vc6x-cUzTg.text: This is a bit of a hidden gem, I think this place is formerly used as a public toilet, which sounds a bit disgusting seen as it is a restaurant now but it really is quite cute. They have kept some of its old characteristics and the board says: the urinals have been cleaned properly, lol! I came here for my daily dose if poached eggs with avocado on toast and let the picture speak for itself! The only downside I would say is that for group dinners you wouldn't be able to come here as it is simply too small. Next time I am coming here I will try some of their sweet breakfast options as what my neighbour is having, a maple cyrup toast thing, looks absolutely mouth watering, I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Hii

Uv9Rt_PZtbNJc9ZgEd7tPQ.text: Really nice cafe with good food, good coffee and a interesting interior.Firstly you can't get past the fact that it's built inside an old toilet. If you can't come to terms with the idea of drinking your coffee snugly positioned within an old urinal, make sure you get one of the tables because it's still worth coming here. Urinals aside, the old tiled walls decked out with the new funky decor makes for a place you definitely want to hang around in. I ordered the smashed avocado and added the poached eggs for a few extra £. Really simple, well executed food that you can't complain about. Add to that a coffee that was one of the best I've had in London- and coming in around £10 it's a great way to start your day. Not only have I never spent so long in a public bathroom, it's the first one i'm looking forward to hitting up again the next time I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Sit down urinals at last!!!
Photo of Attendant - London, United Kingdom. Smashed avo with poached eggs.
